programme.title: Mission: Impossible

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The Earth is built to last. It is a 4,550,000,000-year-old, 5,973,600,000,000,000,000,000-tonne ball of rock and iron. It has taken more devastating asteroid hits in its lifetime than you've had hot dinners, and it still orbits happily around the sun.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: In terms of the Universe, we know we don't know much, especially when it comes to dark matter and dark energy. Scientists are devoting so much of their time to discovering as much as the possibly can about this mysterious matter.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Juno, Cassini and Beyond
programme.desc: The Amazing Cassini spacecraft and its sibling lander, Huygens, have now concluded their scientific studies, bringing back years of data. Now, Juno piercing the cloak of Jupiter and her distant relative New Horizons at the edge of the solar system.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Juno, Cassini and Beyond
programme.desc: The Amazing Cassini spacecraft and its sibling lander, Huygens, have now concluded their scientific studies, bringing back years of data. Now, Juno piercing the cloak of Jupiter and her distant relative New Horizons at the edge of the solar system.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Interface
programme.desc: The interface between Earth and space is the Ionosphere, a region of rarified gas and charged particles. It is very important for radio communications, radar, satellite signals and global positioning. Yet we know so little about it.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Edge of the Universe
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe, the further back in time we reach. Most of what we see is actually dark matter and dark energy, but its nature eludes us ... for the moment.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Exo Planets
programme.desc: As scientists and astronomers peer more closely and with evermore fidelity at nearby stars, they are discovering countless exo planets. How many Earth-like planets are out there? Could one of them hold life not so different from our own?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: In terms of the Universe, we know we don't know much, especially when it comes to dark matter and dark energy. Scientists are devoting so much of their time to discovering as much as the possibly can about this mysterious matter.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Living with Space

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: With approximately 130 active volcanoes, Indonesia is arguably the most active place on earth. Volcanologist Tom Pfeiffer leads an expedition to some of Indonesia most remote and rarely visited volcanos.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Volcanic folklore is reflected in Mexican history. One of their ancient legends tells the story of the Aztec warrior Popocatépetl - a giant active volcano - who erupts to wake his sleeping princess Iztaccíhuatl, a neighboring extinct ice capped volcano.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: In Indonesia we find regions where the air is so toxic that it's 40 times above human safe levels and sulphuric acid vents from the ground in dense yellowish clouds. Elsewhere, small volcanoes are so active, they are said to erupt every 15 minutes!

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Japan is going through a seismic crisis after the devastating Tsunami of 2011. We look closely at two very dangerous volcanoes; both are considered to be in the top 5 most dangerous on the planet.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: For people who live on active volcanoes, life has an element of impermanence to it. There is always the fear that one day their turn will come, and their home will be in the path of the volcano.
programme.sub-title: In the Path of a Volcano

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: The human race is constantly looking for a better way to get from point A to point B. From tall ships to the invention of the automobile, travel has always been a necessity.

programme.title: Supersize Structures

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: For as long as man has been alive, he has fought to defend what is rightfully his and fought even harder to take what is not. He soon figured out, the man with the biggest weapon has the advantage.

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: People aren't the only ones that need to travel. Our way of life has always relied on the transportation of cargo, freight and raw materials. Transport has needed to evolve to keep up with the demand.

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: Mankind has proved time and time again that they are more than capable of dreaming big. Ferocious ambition has produced both world-renowned monuments and monumental gaffs.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Preparing favorite French dishes such as cassoulet or tarte Tatin calls for a lot of patience and time. We wondered if we could find ways to simplify these recipes without sacrificing the qualities that make them classics.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In the test kitchen, we think afternoon (or morning) tea is an excellent excuse to whip up a batch of scones or a golden loaf of lemon pound cake. Making these baked goods at home certainly yields better results than what you can buy. We'll show you how.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Some days you don't mind spending the morning preparing eggs or baking muffins. But rubbery omelets and dry, hockey puck muffins can make you wonder why you bothered. These brunch recipes are special enough to make you long for Sunday mornings.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Few recipes deliver so much pleasure for so little work as pancakes. The batter comes together in minutes, and the cooking time is brief. Why, then, do most Americans never make pancakes from scratch?

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Although easy to prepare, most cookie recipes are notoriously fickle. A minor ingredient change or fluctuation in oven temperature can yield unexpected results. Our goal was simple: Take two favorite cookies and develop reliable recipes that taste great.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We especially like to use summer berries in a no-bake pie. We wanted a no-bake pie that was every bit as appealing as a traditional double-crust pie—without all of the work.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: The test kitchen decided to tackle two popular sheet cakes—carrot and chocolate—and produce simple recipes that would deliver superior results.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Although some would never dare to adulterate plain cheesecake, variations abound—some good, some bad, some ugly. We wanted our cheesecake to be both light and creamy, with great lemon flavor.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to a Latin classic, Arroz con Pollo. Then, Jack challenges Bridget to a tasting of store-bought whipped topping. And finally, Christie reveals the steps for a Florida favorite, Sour Orange Pie.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Julia reveals the secrets to making Citrus-Braised Pork Tacos. Then, Jack challenges Julia to a Mild Salsa taste test. Next, Christie shows Julia how to achieve unforgettable Churros right at home. Finally, Adam shares his favorite piping bag.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Julia and Bridget revive a traditional recipe for Wellesley Fudge Cake. Then, Adam reveals his top pick for immersion blenders. And finally, Bryan makes Bridget a Southern specialty, Chicken and Pastry.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Soup for supper is an appealing concept, especially on a cold night. But for soup to work as a main course, it better be hearty. Our vibrant lentil soup fits the bill, and we round out this meal with quick cheese bread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Some local dishes become so popular that they transcend their region. Gumbo is a taste of Louisiana in a big old bowl. And Cincinnati chili is American original, served with buttered spaghetti, kidney beans, cheddar cheese, and chopped onions.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: It sometimes seems the simplest recipes suffer the worst fate in modern cookbooks. The test kitchen was committed to breathing new life into these old-fashioned American recipes: stuffed pork chops, gravy, and glazed carrots.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We offer two inspired takes on roast chicken. Our roast lemon chicken ends with a twist. And there's nothing conventional about cooking a butterflied chicken under a brick. But these two recipes both deliver crisp skin and lots of flavors.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Quick and easy weeknight cooking can still yield great results. We start with two quick-cooking classics— sautéed chicken cutlets and pan-seared shrimp—and elevate them from the everyday.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we offer delicious, relatively straightforward fare that appeals to young and old. What kid—or adult—doesn't look forward to macaroni and cheese or barbecued chicken?

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We take some of our favorite restaurant recipes—Crab Towers and Flambéed Pan-Roasted Lobster—and show you how to make them work in a home kitchen.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Huge meaty flavor—combined with spice, smoke, and fire—epitomizes Texas barbecue. Could we figure out how to make authentic Texas beef ribs in our Boston-based test kitchen?

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: On occasion, we break the bank and buy a beef tenderloin. The tender, buttery interior is the big draw, and the combination of a healthy dose of seasoning and the flavor from the grill is a perfect solution to an otherwise mild-tasting piece of meat.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare grilled chicken with a sweet-and-sour dipping sauce and grilled salmon with a sweet, sticky glaze.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare chicken enchiladas and Mexican rice.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Sure, raw tomato sauces are fast, but if the sauce is watery and bland, who cares? Likewise, asparagus-based pasta sauces are often bland and boring. In this episode, we keep things simple while avoiding these common problems.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: The test kitchen prepares two Indian favorites: chicken biryani and mulligatawny soup.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pissaladière is Provençal street food, a fragrant, pizza-like tart prized for its contrast of salty black olives and anchovies against a backdrop of sweet caramelized onions and thyme. We figure out how to make a great version of this French classic.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Too often, eggplant Parmesan is a soggy, oily mess. And pasta with chicken and broccoli is heavy and bland. But after many tests in the kitchen, we've come up with recipes that give these simple, honest dishes the respect they deserve.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pasta all' amatriciana is perhaps Rome's most famous dish. Despite the fancy name, it's nothing more than long-strand pasta sauced with tomatoes, onion, bacon, and hot pepper flakes and dusted with cheese. We show you how to master this simple dish.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Osso buco, literally "bone with a hole," is the Italian term for veal shanks. This meaty cut, akin to beef shanks or lamb shanks, becomes meltingly tender when stewed for several hours in a covered pot. We serve it with a simple and satisfying polenta.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Our goal was simple: Take French onion soup and baked goat cheese salad and make stellar versions of these bistro favorites.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: A sticky bun should be neither dense nor bready, neither saturated with butter nor so sugary that it makes your heart race. The crumb should be tender and feathery and the sticky glaze gently chewy and gooey. Here's how we made ours.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Brownies are too often dull, and blondies (as well as congo bars, their coconut-flavored cousins) can be even worse, since they are even plainer. We decided to keep things simple while focusing on developing superior flavor and texture.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: The holidays are stressful enough. We created a foolproof rolled butter cookie dough that tasted great and can be turned into an array of different cookies.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Christie shows Julia how to make Oregon Blackberry Pie. Then, Adam shows Bridget his top pick for pie plates. Next, Jack challenges Julia to a tasting of ready-made pie crusts. Finally, Bridget and Julia make Roasted Salmon with Broccoli and Red Potatoes.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Follow Team Chaos's journey, from humble beginnings to how they ended up building one of the most feared Robots ever to compete.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Former holiday camp bluecoats enter the competition with their `launcher' Apollo. Father and-son-team Kan-Opener have a robot with huge piercing claws. A team of engineering students have created a future tech machine called Sweeney Todd.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Featuring one of the most bizarre, but certainly the tallest robot ever seen on `Robot Wars', Gabriel, built by Mensa member Craig and his three sons. It has wheels as tall as a washing machine and a huge samurai sword.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Winner robots from rounds one through five battle it out in the arena, a wild card from the runners up throws a spanner in the works as it tries to overthrow attempts at glory.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A new spinner has something to prove and a family team pour blood, sweat and tears into keeping their robot wars dream alive. The robots compete through brutal group battles and fierce head to heads for a place in the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The challenge for competitors is even tougher as the infamous House Robots have been let off the leash in a new twist. This is the second heat, and only one of the eight teams can go through to the series grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Four teams progress into a mini league going head to head in a bid for points. The top two teams will face each other in the heat final for the chance to secure their place in this series' grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This fourth heat is an explosive display of spinners as old favourites take on new hopefuls. They must dodge the arena hazards and the menacing new twist as house robots are unleashed to attack competitors and inflict maximum damage.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The reigning champions Apollo mount their defence of the title. They face stiff competition from Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'N'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It is the grand final and the teams must dodge the arena hazards and, in a menacing new twist, they can also hit the Arena Tyre to unleash the dreaded House Robots, allowing them to inflict maximum damage anywhere in the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This round determines which of the fighting machines makes it into the grand final, along with the final two robots to compete in the Ten Robot Rumble. Thor, Coyote, Expulsion, Hobgoblin, Push to Exit and Magnetar battle it out.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Picture-framing technique; picnic tins; finishing woodworking projects; orange-sherbet bombe; garden mosaics; pita pockets.
programme.sub-title: Heat Gun; Orange Sherbet Bombe; Tabbouleh Salad

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Grilled chicken; salsa.
programme.sub-title: Grilled Chicken with Citrus Salsa; Avocado and Jicama Salad

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock; learn the how-tos of building a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring; then everything you need to know about hostas; Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's new passion project is the maze she's building on her Bedford farm; she shares her plans and inspiration for the project and teaches the proper measuring, staking and fertilizing techniques to properly plant successful trees.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shows how to properly move an established tree on her very own Christmas tree farm; she gives a tour of her pinetum where she teaches about new and unusual conifer trees.
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Bleach: Fade to Black
programme.desc: Ichigo must fight a lonely battle to save Rukia before the two are forced to part ways forever!

programme.title: Bleach: Hellverse
programme.desc: Ichigo must travel into the depths of Hell to save his younger sister Yuzu.

programme.title: Demon City Shinjuku
programme.desc: A young warrior battles against a city overtaken by demons, one devil at a time. To save Tokyo from evil, he must defeat a sinister psychic from the underworld.

programme.title: God Mars
programme.desc: In this anime spinoff of the sci-fi television series, Takeru has been sent from a distant planet to destroy the earth. However, as he learns of the beauty of the earth and its inhabitants, he begins to question his mission.

programme.title: Robot Carnival
programme.desc: Robots good and evil star in this '80s sci-fi anime anthology. Stories include evil techno overlords intent on destruction, to a cyborg on a mission to save a young girl, to the story of a beautiful robot creation that haunts its creator, and beyond.

programme.title: The Professional Golgo 13
programme.desc: After killing the son of a powerful oil tycoon, an infamous hit-man is targeted by American governmental forces and superhuman assassins.

programme.title: DEEMO Memorial Keys [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: Deemo lives in a castle all by herself and one day, a little girl falls from the sky. Alice doesn't remember anything about her past and Deemo tries to help her. A tree begins to grow whenever the piano plays, weaving a mystery.

programme.title: Fortune Favors Lady Nikuko
programme.desc: The story of a mother and daughter and their lives aboard a boat in a fishing town.

programme.title: Welcome To The Space Show [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: Five kids go on amazing adventures through the universe after they rescue an injured alien.

programme.title: 10 Tokyo Warriors: The Final Battle
programme.desc: Long ago, the land was in a state of chaos as the feudal lords waged territorial wars. In the midst of the bloodshed, a ferocious warrior, known as the Demon King, appeared and conquered all. It is now 400 years later.

programme.title: Escape Plan: Escape Plan
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and 50 Cent star as inmates who must break out of a top secret, high-security prison in this non-stop action-thriller.

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Two young people are entangled in the ongoing battle between good and evil.

programme.title: Eaten By Lions
programme.desc: A hilarious and heart-warming story of half brothers Omar and Pete, who embark on a journey from Bradford to Blackpool to find Omar's real Dad.

programme.title: Big Momma's House
programme.desc: In order to protect a woman from a robber, a male FBI agent disguises himself as an elderly woman.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Benji
programme.desc: Two school kids strike up a friendship with an orphaned puppy named Benji. When danger befalls them and they end up kidnapped by robbers who are in over their heads, Benji and his scruffy sidekick come to the rescue.

programme.title: The Internship
programme.desc: Old-school salesmen Billy (Vince Vaughn) and Nick (Owen Wilson) try to reboot their careers by joining Google’s fiercely competitive internship program — with hilarious results!

programme.title: The Way Back: The Way Back
programme.desc: A small band of convicts stage a daring escape from a World War II-era Siberian gulag, and embark on a treacherous journey across five countries in a race for freedom and survival.

programme.title: Push
programme.desc: Superhumans defy a government plot to harness and abuse their powers. Chris Evans and Dakota Fanning (the TWILIGHT films) team in a pulse-pounding paranormal thriller.

programme.title: Mail Order Monster
programme.desc: A girl seeks help and guidance from a robot monster to cope with the bullies at school and her father's new girlfriend.

programme.title: A Horse For Alex
programme.desc: A Horse For Alex tells the moving story of Alex, a teenage bully who spends her time lashing out at classmates. When she is persuaded to attend a summer camp with her friends she expects the worst but the more time she spends with the beautiful horses...

programme.title: Heaven Must Wait
programme.desc: An American inherits an old village church in England, where treasure is buried. Greedy Mr. Slee scents his opportunity to snatch the treasure. Diggity, a little cherub trying to earn his wings, helps uncover the treasure for the benefit of the village.

programme.title: Captain Sabertooth
programme.desc: The orphan boy Pinky follows the Captain on an exciting and dangerous journey across the big oceans to the kingdom of Lama Rama, hunting for a treasure and the answer to who is Pinky's father.

programme.title: The BFG: The Original Movie
programme.desc: A young orphan girl, Sophie, gets taken away to a faraway land populated by Giants and Dreams.

programme.title: Ratchet and Clank
programme.desc: When the galaxy comes under the threat of a nefarious space captain, a mechanic and his newfound robot ally join an elite squad of combatants to save the universe.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: Samantha Mackenzie wants what every college freshman desires: to experience life away from home and parents. It's not going to be easy, however, because home for Sam is the White House, and her dad is the President of the United States.

programme.title: The Sorcerer's Apprentice
programme.desc: Ben Clark yearns to learn magic from his new neighbor, Milner. Milner hesitates to help Ben because he carries the same scar as the original bearer of an ancient staff that was wielded in the battle between good and evil 1,400 years ago.

programme.title: A Fairy Tale After All
programme.desc: A teenage girl is transported into a world of fantasy and fairy tales while at a school marionette show. She realizes her own imagination has an adventure already scripted for her that carries more wisdom than she could ever find in the real world.

programme.title: Firehouse Dog
programme.desc: Hollywood's most pampered pooch gets lost during a commercial shoot and ends up as the mascot for a local fire station.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Storm Warning
programme.desc: A storm is racing towards the north Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the captains have no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Hell On The High Seas
programme.desc: It is week eight of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, and cracks are starting to show in the Gloucester fleet, with captains and crews pushing each other to the limit.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Meltdown
programme.desc: Tensions reach their breaking point amongst the Gloucester fleet as captains, mates and vessels fall apart.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Carnage
programme.desc: It's a battle of wills on the North Atlantic, as two of Gloucester's top Bluefin fishermen - friends-turned-foes Paul Hebert and Dave Carraro - go head-to-head to out-fish each other.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: All Hands On Deck
programme.desc: With only four weeks left in the Atlantic Bluefin season, two boats have the challenge of novice fishermen on board – and it could make or break their season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Uncharted Territory
programme.desc: The Atlantic Bluefin are starting to migrate out of New England waters, so the Gloucester fleet races to find any edge they can, but will their risky new strategies pay off?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Twice Bitten
programme.desc: With only two weeks left on the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, just one fish is not enough for the Gloucester captains – and the lure of doubling their luck is overpowering.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Money On The Line
programme.desc: In the first episode of a two-part season finale, Gloucester's reigning Bluefin champion Dave Carraro, of FV-tuna.com, starts the fishing season with a $20,000 lead over his rival.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Endgame
programme.desc: With only three days left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the captains of Gloucester race against each other - and an oncoming storm - in the battle to land their final fish of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Wicked Return
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out for Jeffrey's Ledge in hopes of catching the first fish of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Checkmate
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Blue Fin Tuna Season and the Gloucester captains and their crews, from rookies to old pros, get put to the test.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Into The Storm
programme.desc: Bad weather threatens to end the fishing week for the Gloucester fishermen, but while some boats head for home, others decide to take on Mother Nature's wrath.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Operation T.U.N.A
programme.desc: As the hunt for blue fin tuna intensifies, the fisherman resort to espionage for information.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bite Fight
programme.desc: It's the fifth week of the season and the entire fleet battle for the most successful fishing spots.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mission: Fishin!
programme.desc: As Gloucester's Bluefin tuna fleet charges into the heart of the fishing season, it's a tight race for the coveted title of top-earning boat.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Latitude
programme.desc: It's almost halfway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and the Gloucester fleet has hit a lull in fishing.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Battle Royale
programme.desc: With the second half of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna fishing season now underway, competition amongst the Gloucester fleet intensifies when tuna become scarce.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Brotherly Shove
programme.desc: A new week calls for new techniques as the Gloucester Captains try unconventional methods to hook their next paycheck.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Blue Grit
programme.desc: Time is running out in the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and, this week, every boat in the Gloucester fleet is facing a different challenge.

programme.title: What We Know With Max Foster
programme.desc: Max Foster brings a definitive round-up of the day's top stories, giving you the urgent need-to-know context and diving deeper into the questions sparking debate around the world.

programme.title: At Eternity's Gate
programme.desc: A journey inside the world and mind of Vincent van Gogh; a person who, despite skepticism, ridicule and illness, created some of the world's most beloved and stunning works of art.

programme.title: Diana
programme.desc: The last two years of Princess Diana's life: her campaign against land mines and her relationship with surgeon Dr Hasnat Khan.

programme.title: Back In The Day
programme.desc: A young boxer is taken under the wing of a mob boss after his Mother dies and his Father is run out of town for being an abusive alcoholic.

programme.title: Beatriz at Dinner
programme.desc: A holistic medicine practitioner attends a wealthy client's dinner party after her car breaks down.

programme.title: The Longest Week
programme.desc: Affluent and aimless, Conrad Valmont (Jason Batman) lives a life of leisure in his parent's prestigious Manhattan Hotel. In the span of one week, he finds himself evicted, disinherited, and... in love.

programme.title: Sunshine Cleaning
programme.desc: Former high school cheerleading captain Rose (Amy Adams) is a thirty-something single mother who cleans houses for a living. Wanting to send her trouble-making son Oscar to a private school, Rose decides to take her married lover's (Steve Zahn) advice.

programme.title: Mid90s
programme.desc: Written and directed by Jonah Hill, Mid90s follows Stevie, a thirteen-year-old in 90s-era LA who spends his summer navigating between his troubled home life and a group of new friends that he meets at a Motor Avenue skate shop.

programme.title: Laggies
programme.desc: In the throes of a quarter-life crisis, Megan panics when her boyfriend proposes. She takes an opportunity to escape for a week, hiding out in the house of her new 16-year-old friend Annika and her world-weary single dad.

programme.title: Life of a King
programme.desc: Academy Award winner Cuba Gooding Jr. stars as an ex-felon on a path of redemption, defying convention when he establishes a chess club for inner-city teenagers in D.C.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrow's generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Gironde is the largest and most powerful tidal current in Europe. When the Gironde flows into the Atlantic, it is 15 kilometers wide and in the rhythm of the tides, it brings the waters from the Pyrenees and the Massif Central into the ocean. This often pushes its waters far out into the Gironde at high tide.This creates a world of its own that has shaped everything uniquely and intensely for tens of thousands of years. The water surface of the river is so large that the evaporation has created its own microclimate, which is stable and, together with the brackish waters, has influenced flora and fauna on the right and left of the bank for a long time.

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Dordogne consists of a visible and an invisible system of flowing water. Caves and basins under the earth's surface store the excess water and return it to the river when it is dry. A perfect management of a precious resource, not invented by humans, but by the complex nature itself. The result is an ever life-giving river.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 1
programme.desc: Winter means more than just the beginning of the year for the people of Lofoten: For more than a thousand years, Lofoten has been a hub for cod fishing, with seasons lasting from February to April as huge shoals migrate from the Barents Sea to these waters. During these hectic months, more than 65,000 tons of fish are brought to shore, securing the income for the whole of Lofoten for years to come. Around a quarter of the fish caught ends up on lines to dry upon racks. From a young age, the children from the fishing villages get to earn some pocket money by cutting cod tongues and selling the produce as a delicacy appreciated by the locals.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 2
programme.desc: Almost unnoticeably, spring turns into summer. The days become longer and longer, with a never-setting sun. People who have spent their winter and spring working hard can finally enjoy their own nature, even though the temperature is only slightly warmer. Lofoten is sparsely populated, just 24,000 people live here. Unstad is one of its smallest communities with only 15 inhabitants, but despite that, it has become a hotspot for arctic surf and is host to the northern-most surf center in the world. Surfers from all over the globe come to surf in the arctic water.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de Valensole”, our viewers encounter Gérard Blanc, who has been hit particularly hard. The lavender farmer lost sixty percent of his harvest to one tiny insect: the leafhopper. This insect has already destroyed half of the lavender acreage, bumping France from its market position as the world’s top producer of lavender oil. The film visits a resolute farmer who, not about to give up, is testing methods to fend off the voracious insect.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The progress of first cultivation attempts is slow. In India, the rural population, especially, needs affordable, well-tolerated medicine – medicine based on herbs. In Kerala, the film shows a family operation that hand-produces botanical medicine for the local market. High up in the Himalayas, we observe a village healer at work. The science of Ayurvedic medicine is five thousand years old. Today, interest in the ancient healing art is surging, not only in India. In Delhi’s Old Town, the film visits a wholesaler who supplies the booming global herb market, and we take a look inside the laboratories of the largest manufacturer of Ayurvedic medicines in the world. In Kerala, we meet a doctor employed at a small Ayurveda clinic, and in Nordern India, we join a student of Tibetan medicine on a hike up into the mountains, where she prepares for an exam in herbology.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on preserving this invaluable knowledge.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian distillery in Germany, Hubsi digs for protected gentian roots in Berchtesgaden National Park. For yellow gentian is one of the most bitter medicinal herbs in the world, well suited for schnapps and as a general tonic.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for entering and exiting the narrow blossom is strenuous. Within three weeks, maximum, Mladen must remove his bees from the island. Otherwise they will die of exhaustion. In Skopje, the capital of Macedonia, the film visits Iva Yosifova. Hollyhock provides the raw material for her objects of art. The herb is medically beneficial, due to its mucilage, which is added to many cough tea mixtures. Iva, though, makes paper from hollyhock. Thanks to the herb’s long fibres, the paper can be spread onto objects and modeled. The technique produces delicate sculptures, as fragile as nature.

programme.title: Aurora - Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: In the earth’s polar regions, a ghostly flicker and colourful glow often brighten the night sky. Whoever sees an aurora event will never forget this impressive experience. Finland’s Saami people, Alaska’s Inuit, Canada’s Native Americans and New Zealand’s Maori all have legends about the origins and meaning of this magic natural spectacle. These stories tell of spirits dancing in the sky, of a bright and better world where hunting game is abundant, of battling gods and celestial messages.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrow's generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrow's generations a home worth living in? programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Leap Of The Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries – cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage. The diversity and beauty of these locations are truly stunning and their character and history as relevant to this story as that of the big cat itself. Until five years ago, both populations of Iberian lynx were quickly fading away. Their fragmented habitats were shrinking even further, they were starved by lack of prey and reduced by epidemics. But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.

programme.title: Max's Big Tracks
programme.sub-title: Sand Track In Search of the Desert Elephant
programme.desc: Max tracks the Desert Elephant in a harsh desert, learning survival from the Himba tribe and Dr. Leggett.

programme.title: Max's Big Tracks
programme.sub-title: Mountain Odyssey In Search of the Yeti
programme.desc: Max explores Yeti myths in the Himalayas, tracking bears with sherpas and locals to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Epic Safari Destinations
programme.desc: Craig and Kristina visit Sango Lodge, joining Bryce Clemence's anti - poaching dog unit team.

programme.title: Epic Safari Destinations
programme.desc: Kristina explores Mana Pools, spotting lion cubs, wild dog puppies, & a bull elephant with Cloud and Richard.

programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Kevin Richardson must transport 28 lions and 14 hyenas to a sanctuary, ensuring their welfare.

programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Kevin Richardson must transport 28 lions and 14 hyenas to a sanctuary, ensuring their welfare.

programme.title: Megeti
programme.desc: A lone Ethiopian Wolf battles the elements and other predators as she tries to unite with a pack.

programme.title: Congo's Call Of The Wild
programme.desc: Congo, home to the world's second largest rainforest and national park, faces threats from poachers

programme.title: The Global Whale Shark Mystery
programme.desc: The whale shark, a giant predator, remains a mystery, with new human connections adding to its intrigue.

programme.title: The Original Whale Riders
